Description: Cimetiere des Mamloùks, one of three studies for Plate 23 of the artist's 'Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte, pendant les campagnes du Général Bonaparte', 1802; cemetery of the Mamelukes, elaborate tombs, some with domed roofs, at right a mosque and minaret, soldiers near the foreground Pen and grey ink, with grey wash
Producer name: Drawn by: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Curator's comments: Engraved by Jean Duplessi-Bertaux. There is no copy of Denon's 'Voyage...' in the Department. The B.L. copy is at 458.h.12. The minutes of the Trustees' meeting on 12th December, 1835, record that "two or three" of the drawings were missing when the group was offered to the Museum.
Exhibition history: 2006 April-Sep, BM, Addis Gallery, 'Sense of Place'
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Illustration to: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Associated titles: Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte
